episodes.description: As Deku tries to run away, Class A draws him back by recounting their memories with him and reminding him of his own words.

episodes.title: A Young Woman's Declaration
episodes.description: As the evacuees at U.A. voice their dissent, Ochaco speaks up to try and sway them. Onlookers with ties to Izuku try to figure out if it's time for them to speak out, too.

episodes.title: No Man Is an Island
episodes.description: As Izuku tries to rest and recover back at U.A. with his classmates, All Might has an encounter with Stain that leads to new information about Shigaraki and All For One.

episodes.title: In the Nick of Time! A Big-Time Maverick from the West!
episodes.description: As jailbreakers run rampant in Japan, Star and Stripe flies from the U.S. to Japan to help and finds Shigaraki waiting for her in the middle of her flight path.

episodes.title: Specter
episodes.description: The fight between Star and Stripe and Shigaraki is coming to an end, but Star has one more trick up her sleeve with New Order.

episodes.title: Villain
episodes.description: After failing to steal Star's Quirk, New Order, and losing many other Quirks, Shigaraki and All For One prepare for their next move. Who is the traitor at U.A.?

episodes.title: The Story of How We All Became Heroes
episodes.description: Due to his relationship with All For One, Yuuga Aoyama calls himself a villain, but Deku tells him that he can still be a hero and reaches a hand out to him.

episodes.title: Let You Down
episodes.description: As heroes and villains get ready for the coming battle, Deku and the others leave U.A., and Deku is called out by Aoyama, who is supposed to be in a police cell. What does Aoyama want?

episodes.title: Division
episodes.description: It's finally time for the decisive battle between heroes and villains. The plan by All Might, Aizawa, and the others has them start their fights in various places around Japan.

episodes.title: Inflation
episodes.description: Even though Shigaraki's Quirks are sealed, he attacks Bakugou and the others with a strange new appearance and power. Meanwhile, Deku is pulled to where Toga was warped and Todoroki and Dabi face off.

episodes.title: Two Flashfires
episodes.description: Eleven years ago, Toya Todoroki was burned by his own flames and became Dabi. Todoroki faces Dabi's blue flames with a new move of his own. Will he be able to stop his brother...?

episodes.title: Extras
episodes.description: Shouto Todoroki stopped Dabi with his Great Glacial Aegir, and reports of that bolstered the spirits of the heroes fighting in other locations. And Shouto and Dabi's father, Endeavor, is facing the greatest evil, All For One, with Hawks.

episodes.title: Wounded Hero, Burning Bright and True!!
episodes.description: Before the threat of All For One, Endeavor falls, and Hawks, Jiro, and Tokoyami are also cornered. Even so, Jiro acts like a hero. Endeavor is also encouraged after looking back at his own life.

episodes.title: Light Fades to Rain
episodes.description: Bakugou's Howitzer Impact didn't work against Shigaraki/All For One, either, and Bakugou is pushed into a corner by Shigaraki's power and words. In order to get him out of that predicament, U.A.'s Big Three take a stand.

episodes.title: Those Who Defend, Those Who Violate
episodes.description: Bakugou surprised Shigaraki/All For One with Cluster but was then cruelly pierced through. The heroes in all the different locations are getting pushed back - But even so, they will not give up.

episodes.title: A Chain of Events, Across the Ages
episodes.description: Deku finally arrives at the Coffin in the Sky. Seeing Bakugou and the others defeated by Shigaraki/All For One, Deku shakes with anger. Can he control his feelings and win against Shigaraki? It's finally time for a showdown.

episodes.title: Together with Shoji
episodes.description: Spinner takes heteromorphs who are exploding with resentment from being persecuted to Central Hospital to get Kurogiri back. Shoji, whose Quirk also makes him a heteromorph, shouts his feelings to them.

episodes.title: Butterfly Effect
episodes.description: Spinner and Present Mic both yell their hearts out. Will the one waking up to their voices be Kurogiri, or Shirakumo? Meanwhile, fighting Ochako and the others on Okuto Island, Toga is finally going to use her secret weapon.

episodes.title: The Chain Thus Far
episodes.description: Toga consumed Twice's blood, and with Kurogiri's Warp, infinite doubles of Twice appear. Shigaraki's Decay is also released, and the heroes seem to be in a state of despair. But then, help comes from an unexpected quarter.

episodes.title: Hopes
episodes.description: With the addition of Gentle, La Brava, and Lady Nagant, Deku is able to restrain Shigaraki's hands and confront him on the ground. Meanwhile, at the Gunga Villa site, the rewound All For One shows off his awful power.

episodes.title: It's a Small World
episodes.description: Shishikura and the other members of Shiketsu High join the fight at the Gunga Villa site, and it's do-or-die as the heroes unite to fight back. But as All For One gets younger, he gets stronger. That's when unexpected backup arrives...

episodes.title: I Am Here
episodes.description: Trampling the heroes, All For One flies to become one with Shigaraki, and Dabi is about to explode with the heat he's been storing up in his body. Will the Symbol of Peace be able to change this hopeless situation?

episodes.title: A Girl's Ego
episodes.description: Toga transforms into Twice and backs the heroes into a corner with Infinite Doubles. In the midst of that, Ochako does her best to get close to Toga to talk to her. How does Toga respond...?

episodes.title: Battle Without a Quirk
episodes.description: Toga returns the smile of Ochako, who tried to be friends with her. What does Toga do to the seriously-injured Ochako? Meanwhile, All Might uses "power" developed by a friend to face All For One.

episodes.title: Toshinori Yagi: Rising Origin
episodes.description: The fierce battle continues between Armored All Might and All For One. Can All Might possibly win?

episodes.title: The End of an Era, and -
episodes.description: All Might receives help from an unexpected source when Stain joins him in the battle against All For One.

episodes.title: The Final Boss!!
episodes.description: Bakugou is back on his feet! Can he rescue All Might from All For One, and defeat the villain in battle?

episodes.title: Quirk: Explosion!!
episodes.description: The fierce battle with Bakugou reminds All For One of his and his brother Yoichi's origins.

episodes.title: History's Greatest Villain
episodes.description: The balance of power shifts between Izuku and Shigaraki when the latter steals a Quirk from One For All.

episodes.title: Wrench It Open, Izuku Midoriya!
episodes.description: Izuku attempts to forcefully transfer One For All to Shigaraki, as this might prove to be the key to victory.

episodes.title: From Aizawa
episodes.description: Izuku dives deep into Shigaraki's mind, in search of the villain's origin: the tragic Tenko Shimura.

episodes.title: Save! Rescue Training!
episodes.description: Four weeks after the attack on class 1A's rescue practice, the students resumed training. This time, the teachers are injured. They are forced to face the villain all by themselves.

episodes.title: Training of the Dead
episodes.description: Class 1-A teams up with Isamu Academy for survival training, but a zombie-themed Quirk turns it into chaotic fun. Tsuyu reconnects with an old friend amid the mayhem.

episodes.title: All Might Rising
episodes.description: A young Toshinori Yagi inherits the will of his mentor, Nana Shimura, and begins his journey to become the Symbol of Peace in this emotional prequel to Two Heroes.

episodes.title: Make It! Do-or-Die Survival Training 1
episodes.description: In preparation for Class 1-A's Provisional Hero License Exam, Eraser Head decides to give the class a training exercise on disaster rescue, due to previous license exams having a disaster rescue test in most cases.

episodes.title: Make It! Do-or-Die Survival Training 2
episodes.description: Izuku looks up the elevator shaft and notices that sunlight is pouring in from the top. Momo notes that the elevators only lead to the inside of the first floor, leading Tsuyu to theorize the surface has collapsed.

episodes.title: Departure
episodes.description: As Midoriya, Bakugo, and Todoroki prepare to depart for an overseas mission with the Endeavor Agency, nerves, rivalry, and unexpected chaos erupt at the airport before their journey even begins.

episodes.title: HLB
episodes.description: The "Hero League Baseball" is an organization set-up by several Pro Heroes to allow them the chance to play and compete in their spare time. For this year, the "Orcas", led by Gang Orca, and the "Lionels", led by Shishido, have made it to the finals. Present Mic narrates the game, accompanied by an extremely apathetic Eraser Head.

episodes.title: Laugh! As If You Are in Hell
episodes.description: It's been ten months since Izuku en-rolled at U.A. High School, and on top of his regular school work, four days a week he has been continuing his Hero Work-Study at the Endeavor Agency. On one day, they are approached by a police officer, seeking assistance in tracking down a local graffiti artist vandalizing the streets.

episodes.title: U.A. Heroes Battle
episodes.description: Third-year Mirio Togata greets the first-year students in Class A with the card game UA Heroes Battle, where each student picks cards and joins the fierce battle.

series.title: One Punch Man
series.genre: Action, Animation, Anime, Comedy, Fantasy, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Sci-Fi, Superhero
series.description: The story of Saitama, a hero that does it just for fun & can defeat his enemies with a single punch.

episodes.title: The Strongest Man
episodes.description: Saitama is a guy who's a hero for fun. After saving a child from certain death, he decided to become a hero, training hard for three years.

episodes.title: The Lone Cyborg
episodes.description: A monster is moving toward City Z--one that has been created by the mysterious organization known as The House of Evolution.

episodes.title: The Obsessive Scientist
episodes.description: Saitama and Genos glean information about the House of Evolution and its founder, Dr. Genus.

episodes.title: The Modern Ninja
episodes.description: A group of Bald thugs use body armors to terrorize rich people. Sonic Speed, a hired ninja fights them. Unfortunately he meets with Saitama who is also a Bald.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Mentor
episodes.description: Determined to get a little recognition, Saitama decides to become a pro hero, but first, he must pass the Hero Association tests and become a full-fledged member.

episodes.title: The Terrifying City
episodes.description: To remain on the "Hero" list Saitama has to show some activity in every week. Currently the City Z is defined as the 'ghost town'. Heroes are gathered together to find out whats going on.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Disciple
episodes.description: A giant meteor threatens to destroy City Z. All S-Rank heroes are called to City Z to destroy the meteor before its collision.

episodes.title: The Deep Sea King
episodes.description: Several Sea Folk appear and begin attacking citizens. They are easily defeated until The Deep Sea King appears and defeats many heroes including an S-Class.

episodes.title: Unyielding Justice
episodes.description: The fight with the Deep Sea King concludes and Saitama and Genos reflect on it as well as Saitama's promotion to B-Class.

episodes.title: Unparalleled Peril
episodes.description: Saitama and all class S heroes are gathered together to be informed of an imminent extremely danger threat.

episodes.title: The Dominator of the Universe
episodes.description: An alien conqueror lands in a spaceship to conquer the Earth during the S class heroes meeting.

episodes.title: The Strongest Hero
episodes.description: Saitama takes on the alien leader in epic battle as the S class heroes fight the alien warriors and destroy the spaceship.

episodes.title: Return of the Hero
episodes.description: Saitama and Genos are out shopping when they come across G4, a demonic robot on a mission to eliminate King. Meanwhile, Sitch attempts to recruit various assassins and villains.

episodes.title: Human Monster
episodes.description: Garou issues a declaration of war on the Hero Association through terrifying means, Hellish Blizzard gives Saitama an ultimatum, and Genos decides to eliminate his master's stalker, Speed-o'.

episodes.title: The Hunt Begins
episodes.description: Garou attacks the S-rank hero Tank top Master, his followers, and Mumen Rider. Garou continues his pursuit of attacking heroes. Saitama buys a wig to join a martial arts tournament after having a brief exchange with Garou.

episodes.title: Metal Bat
episodes.description: Assigned to guard a VIP and his son, Metal Bat couldn't be less thrilled. But when the group is suddenly attacked all hell breaks loose. Meanwhile, Saitama has disguised himself as Charanko in order to enter the "Super Fight" martial arts tournament.

episodes.title: The Martial Arts Tournament
episodes.description: Metal bat fights Garo. A lot of monsters surface around multiple cities and it is difficult for all the heroes to fight them. Meanwhile, Saitama is at the tournament and Genos is in the audience.

episodes.title: The Uprising of the Monsters
episodes.description: Saitama continues facing opponents in the tournament. Genos receives a stress signal depicting that there are 5 monsters in City C and goes to kill them. Blizzard tries to fight a monster but she turns out be very strong.

episodes.title: Class S Heroes
episodes.description: As the Super Fight tournament heads for its grand finale, the Class S heroes battle to hold back the tide of monster incursions. Meanwhile, Atomic Samurai is setting in motion a plan of his own.

episodes.title: The Resistance of the Strong
episodes.description: Goketsu, the first Super Fight Tournament champion, arrives in the stadium. Having now become a monster, he's aiming to force the Super Fight competitors to turn into monsters themselves. When several do, it's up to Suiryu to take them on alone.

episodes.title: The Troubles of the Strongest
episodes.description: Saitama returns to the battle, but is starting to get through a gloomy state because of an obvious reason.

episodes.title: The Encircling Net of Justice
episodes.description: The Monster Association invited all of the S-Class heroes to their hideout in City Z. Meanwhile, Garo encounters a serious threat.

episodes.title: Everyone's Dignity
episodes.description: Garou continues his fight against the A Class heroes while some prominent S Class heroes make special entrances.

episodes.title: Cleaning Up the Disciple's Mess
episodes.description: As the fight continues between Garou and his former master, Bang, a prominent threat from the Monster Association reappears.

episodes.title: Strategy Meeting
episodes.description: The heroes plan a rescue of a child kidnapped by monsters, while Garou awakens deep underground.

episodes.title: Monster Traits
episodes.description: On his way to hunt heroes, Garou dines and dashes at a restaurant, but is chased by Saitama.

episodes.title: Organism Limits
episodes.description: While Garou battles King the Ripper and Insect God, Hedro-Jellyfish emerges and captures Tareo. Dr. Kuseno delivers a present to Saitama.

episodes.title: Counterattack Signal
episodes.description: The heroes prepare for battle without Silverfang and Genos. Garou attacks the Monster Association.

episodes.title: Monster King
episodes.description: The S-class heroes hurry to save a kidnapped child while Garou wakes up in the Monster Association's hideout.

episodes.title: One Punch Man - Wanpanman: Road to Hero
episodes.description: Before Saitama became a hero, his local tailor tells him that he must close up shop due to pressure from a local gang and Saitama decides to help him out.

episodes.title: A Shadow That Snuck Up Too Close
episodes.description: Genos trying to find out the secret to Saitama's power by stalking him.

episodes.title: The Pupil Who Is an Extremely Poor Talker
episodes.description: A story about Genos when he meets Don Pacino, a C class wanted criminal and his gang in a warehouse along with man who is being held captive by the gang.

episodes.title: The Ninja Who Is Too Complicated
episodes.description: Sonic faces his fear and meets a new friend.

episodes.title: Bang, Who Is Too Overbearing
episodes.description: Silverfang stalks and pursues Saitama and Genos to come to his dojo where he tries to compete with Saitama in old martial arts ways.

episodes.title: One Punch Man - Special: The Sisters Who Have Too Many Things Happening
episodes.description: Story goes around frustrated Fubuki because of her elder sister Tatsumaki. Showing domination of elder sister over little one.

episodes.title: The Murder Case That Is Too Impossible
episodes.description: Child Emperor investigates the murder of Zombieman.

episodes.title: A Super Serious Look Back!
episodes.description: Learn the history of One-Punch Man, and get ready for season 2 with a super serious recap.

episodes.title: Saitama and Those with Reasonable Abilities
episodes.description: Saitama meets a group of villains in a public restroom who mistake him for their ally, they introduce themselves to Saitama, but when he reveals he's a hero, attempt to defeat him.

episodes.title: Old Dudes and Fishing
episodes.description: Atomic Samurai and Bang go out fishing to a lake, and Giant Salamander attacks.

episodes.title: Genos and Memory Loss
episodes.description: Saitama accidentally hits Genos while opening a bag of chips, which causes Genos to forget who he is.

episodes.title: Game and Rivals
episodes.description: Saitama brings Genos to a tournament for the fighting video game "Wild Animals" where they hope to win the grand prize of five million yen.

episodes.title: Puri Puri Prisoner and the Escaped Prisoners
episodes.description: Puri-Puri Prisoner accidentally releases the inmates of Smelly Lid Prison while fighting against a monster. Realizing that the incident may cost a certain cute employee his job, Puri-Puri Prisoner heads out to find the escaped inmates.

episodes.title: Zombieman Murder Case 2: A Chalet Amid the Blizzard, and the Ones Bothered by the Cold
episodes.description: Child Emperor, Zombieman, Superalloy Darkshine, and Metal Bat are dispatched to a forlorn, snowy mountain to hunt down a monster.

episodes.title: Broadcast Commemorative Episode: A Serious Look Back at the Anime One-Punch Man Season 2
episodes.description: We review what's happened so far before the third season begins.

series.title: Ragna Crimson
series.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Anime, Dark Fantasy, Drama, Fantasy, Mystery
series.description: In a world where dragons rule sky, sea, and land, dragon hunter Ragna joins forces with the mysterious Crimson to fight the dragons at any cost and destroy the dragon monarchs.

episodes.title: The Day the Reaper was Born
episodes.description: Death and fire haunt Ragna's dreams and, deep within his heart, he somehow knows they're omens. If he doesn't grow stronger, and soon, all that awaits him is lifelong regret.

episodes.title: The Beginning of the Story
episodes.description: Temruogtaf must be stopped. But Ragna loses interest in the dragon and turns his attention to one of his maids. Thanks to his new old memories, he knows who she really is.

episodes.title: Agitation
episodes.description: Crimson is no hero. He will manipulate and use others if it furthers his goal, and that callousness is precisely what makes him a needed ally against dragons.

episodes.title: Action
episodes.description: Dragons have another weakness aside from sunlight and silverine: pride. But Ultimatia is not like other dragons.

episodes.title: Wing
episodes.description: Ragna met Ultimatia before in another life and he did not emerge from that encounter unscathed. Now, in this life, dragons are disappearing and Ultimatia needs to know why.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.description: Ultimatia may have control over time itself, but Crimson knows her powers must have a weakness. Uncover it and all variables will be accounted for. Or so Crimson thinks.

episodes.title: Act and Guilt
episodes.description: Ragna's relentless assault forces Ultimatia on the defensive. Unaware of his identity, an unexpected emotion overtakes the dragon monarch as their battle rages on: Fear.

episodes.title: A Painful Blow
episodes.description: Ultimatia made an impossible choice and, with Nebulim out for their blood, Ragna and Crimson must now withdraw. However, they may have only exchanged one problem for another.

episodes.title: Negotiation and True Nature
episodes.description: Starlia Reese's ability to see a person's true nature puts Crimson at a disadvantage, but when Ragna suddenly appears, the princess sees something in him she's never seen before.

episodes.title: Stakes and Cooperation
episodes.description: While Crimson uses Ragna as a bargaining chip to convince Starlia to accept their aid, Voltekamui vows to remain at Ultimatia's side and gives her much needed encouragement.

episodes.title: Tactics and Knowledge
episodes.description: Ragna spars with the Argentum Corps and infuses their weapons while Crimson assists with the teleportation circles. But they are not the only ones preparing for battle.

episodes.title: Determination and Readiness
episodes.description: The battle begins at sunset, but before they confront an uncertain fate, Starlia asks Ragna to listen to a heartfelt request.

episodes.title: Hero of the Battle
episodes.description: The battle has begun, but Ragna and the Argentum Corps are not facing just any enemy. They are facing those who mean to exterminate them by any means necessary.

episodes.title: Impatience and Vigilance
episodes.description: Olto Zora's cunning plan overwhelms the corps as they face the power of mature dragons. However, Crimson's impending offensive and Starlia's resolve may be the key to victory.

episodes.title: Latent Awakening
episodes.description: The tide is turning as the corps claw their way through the battlefield--Ragna and Starlia the source of their inspiration. But none are aware of Crimson's callous scheme.

episodes.title: Will of Resistance
episodes.description: Olto Zora used to be someone else once, and Starlia reminds him of someone he knew long ago.

episodes.title: My Comrade
episodes.description: Olto Zora and Taratectora are lifelong friends who stand at a crossroads that could determine the battle. Now, Ragna and Starlia may be the only ones who can prevent calamity.

episodes.title: End of the Battle to the Death
episodes.description: The battle is over, but at a heavy price. While a weary corps mourn their losses, representatives from the Solarian Church arrive to meet the fabled Reaper.

episodes.title: Reason to Fight
episodes.description: Ragna has found a reason to fight, and he and the Argentum Corps will take the battle to the Blood of the Wing, no matter what Crimson thinks.

episodes.title: Just Watch Me
episodes.description: Four superior dragons stand between them and the Winged Monarch. With unyielding resolve, the Argentum Corps storm a dead capital for the final battle.

episodes.title: Words Aren't Needed
episodes.description: Multiple battles erupt in an all-out war against the Blood of the Wing. As each side engages in mortal combat, a crucial decision awaits Crimson.

episodes.title: The Winged Monarch
episodes.description: The darkest hour is at hand. As cherished comrades fall on both sides, bittersweet memories of the past surge to the forefront.

episodes.title: Lightning God
episodes.description: As Ragna and Voltekamui's titanic battle rages across the heavens, the dragon is reminded of another encounter, one that shaped him into the warrior he is today.

episodes.title: Light
episodes.description: Just as Ragna, Crimson and the Argentum Corps stand at the cusp of victory, the worst case scenario occurs: Against all odds, Ultimatia reclaims her dominion over time.

series.title: Frieren: Beyond Journey's End
series.genre: Adult Animation, Adventure, Animation, Anime, Fantasy Epic, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Japanese, Shonen, Sword & Sorcery, Iyashikei
series.description: Elf mage Frieren and her fellow adventurers have defeated the Demon King and brought peace to the land. But Frieren will long outlive the rest of her former party. How will she come to understand what life means to the people around her?

episodes.title: Bken no owari
episodes.description: The world celebrates the Demon King's defeat at the hands of the Hero and his companions. Now that their great adventure is over, what will Frieren the mage do next?

episodes.title: Betsuni mah janakutatte...
episodes.description: Frieren instructs Fern in the use of magic while deciphering a grimoire for Heiter.

episodes.title: Hito o korosu mah
episodes.description: While retracing the path she took on her adventure with her former traveling companions, Frieren confronts an old enemy.

episodes.title: Tamashii no nemuru chi
episodes.description: Frieren and Fern pay a visit to Eisen, who requests their help in finding the notes of Flamme the Legendary Mage.

episodes.title: Shisha no gen'ei
episodes.description: Frieren and Fern investigate ghost sightings at a village where people have started going missing.

episodes.title: Mura no eiy
episodes.description: Frieren and Fern enlist Stark's help to fight the solar dragon - but is he up to the task?

episodes.title: Otogibanashi no y na mono
episodes.description: After reflecting on the transient nature of the past as it exists in people's collective memories, Frieren unexpectedly runs into a sworn enemy.

episodes.title: Ss no Furren
episodes.description: As tensions in Graf Granat's domain reach a breaking point, Fern and Stark find their own resolve - and Frieren resumes an old duty.

episodes.title: Dantdai no Aura
episodes.description: While Fern and Stark make a temporary retreat with Graf Granat, Frieren's true foe awaits her outside the city.

episodes.title: Tsuyoi mahtsukai
episodes.description: The great mage Flamme meets Frieren, the sole survivor of an elven village attacked by the demon king's army, and shares her knowledge. The battle between Frieren and Aura comes to an end.

episodes.title: Kitagawa shokoku no fuyu
episodes.description: Frieren, Fern and Stark continue their journey, but the winter road in the northern countries is much harder than they had imagined.

episodes.title: Honmono no ysha
episodes.description: Frieren's Party reaches the Village of Swords where Himmel wielded the Hero's Sword 80 years ago - a weapon reserved for those capable of defeating world-threatening evil. Memories from that time flood Frieren's mind.

episodes.title: Dzoku ken'o
episodes.description: While passing by a village in the woods of the northern lands, Frieren and party meet Sein, a gifted priest who is nonetheless corrupt enough to give even Heiter a run for his money. But what happened in his past?

episodes.title: Wakamono no tokken
episodes.description: Stark and Fern quarrel. Sein, who has recently joined Frieren's group, gives them advice on how to work things out, which sparks Frieren's memories of her deceased friends.

episodes.title: Yakkaigoto no nioi
episodes.description: When the party happens upon a town whose inhabitants are all mysteriously asleep, it's time for their newest traveling companion to prove his mettle.

episodes.title: Chju tomodachi
episodes.description: Frieren pays a visit to Old Man Voll, a long-lived friend of hers, with traveling companions in tow.

episodes.title: J genki de
episodes.description: The time has come for Sein to decide whether he will continue traveling with his companions or begin his personal journey to find his friend.

episodes.title: Ikky mahtsukai senbatsu shiken
episodes.description: Frieren and party finally arrive in uerst, ready to undergo the first-class mage exam, and meet a number of colorful characters who are there to do the same.

episodes.title: Nynen na keikaku
episodes.description: Frieren and her new teammates hatch a plan to capture a Stille, but are the other teams just going to stand by and let it happen?

episodes.title: Hitsuyna koroshi
episodes.description: The first-class mage exam intensifies as fighting breaks out between the participants, and what's at stake might even be worth killing for.

episodes.title: Mah no sekai
episodes.description: Frieren, Kanne, and Lawine struggle with the 13th party over possession of the Stille, but there'll be more surprises in store before their battle, and the first test, reach their conclusion.

episodes.title: Tsugi kara wa katakidshi
episodes.description: After the conclusion of the first test, the exam participants have some time to kill in town. What do mages get up to on their days off?

episodes.title: Danjon kryaku
episodes.description: Aspiring mages undertake their next trial: overcoming the untouched Ruins of the King's Tomb, purportedly easy by the examiner but with unknown risks.

episodes.title: Kanpeki na fukuseitai
episodes.description: Due to the Spiegel, a legendary monster that can create perfect replicas of others, the test-takers who would conquer the Ruins of the King's Tomb must first face the ultimate enemy: themselves.

episodes.title: Chimei tekina suki
episodes.description: A perfect imitation of Frieren stands between the test-takers and victory, but Fern believes she knows how to win. Is it time for the student to surpass the master?

episodes.title: Mah no takami
episodes.description: While the other Mages defend themselves against the remaining clones, Fern experiences the heights of Frieren's power as they battle the copycat Frieren.

episodes.title: Ningen no jidai
episodes.description: With the second test behind them, only one remains - but first, Frieren and Fern need to settle an important matter in town. What awaits them in the third test?

episodes.title: Mata atta toki ni hazukashii kara ne
episodes.description: Serie concludes the third and final stage of the First-Class Mage Exam. Many examinees remain in uerst to prepare for their next plans. Frieren, Fern and Stark depart from the city to head further north.

series.title: The Boys
series.genre: Action, Comedy, Crime, Dark Comedy, Drama, Psychological Drama, Romantic Comedy, Sci-Fi, Superhero, Satire
series.description: A group of vigilantes set out to take down corrupt superheroes who abuse their superpowers.

episodes.title: The Name of the Game
episodes.description: When a Supe kills the love of his life, A/V salesman Hughie Campbell teams up with Billy Butcher, a vigilante hell-bent on punishing corrupt Supes -- and Hughie's life will never be the same again.

episodes.title: Cherry
episodes.description: The Boys get themselves a Superhero, Starlight gets payback, Homelander gets naughty, and a Senator gets naughtier.

episodes.title: Get Some
episodes.description: It's the race of the century. A-Train versus Shockwave, vying for the title of World's Fastest Man. Meanwhile, the Boys are reunited and it feels so good.

episodes.title: The Female of the Species
episodes.description: On a very special episode of The Boys... an hour of guts, gutterballs, airplane hijackings, madness, ghosts, and one very intriguing Female. Oh, and lots of heart -- both in the sentimental sense, and in the gory literal sense.

episodes.title: Good for the Soul
episodes.description: The Boys head to the "Believe" Expo to follow a promising lead in their ongoing war against the Supes. There might -- MIGHT -- be a homicidal infant, but you'll have to see for yourself.

episodes.title: The Innocents
episodes.description: SUPER IN AMERICA (2019). Vought Studios. Genre: Reality. Starring: Homelander, Queen Maeve, Black Noir, The Deep, A-Train, Starlight, Tara Reid, Billy Zane.

episodes.title: The Self-Preservation Society
episodes.description: Never trust a washed-up Supe -- the Boys learn this lesson the hard way. Meanwhile, Homelander digs into his past, Starlight discovers that love hurts, and if you're ever in Sandusky, Ohio and a girl asks if she can touch your gills, say NO.

episodes.title: You Found Me
episodes.description: Season Finale Time! Questions answered! Secrets revealed! Conflicts... conflicted! Characters exploded! And so much more!

episodes.title: The Big Ride
episodes.description: With Butcher still missing, Hughie, Mother's Milk, Frenchie, and Kimiko are now fugitives, and Homelander and Vought are more powerful than ever. But just as the Boys are about to leave the country, they are pulled back into the fray.

episodes.title: Proper Preparation and Planning
episodes.description: Butcher is back with the Boys, but tensions flare with Hughie. Homelander spends quality time with his new "family." Starlight and Stormfront bond at a press junket and the Boys hunt down a super terrorist with a startling identity.

episodes.title: Over the Hill with the Swords of a Thousand Men
episodes.description: The Boys take to the high seas to safeguard their prisoner. Homelander plays house, then pushes Ryan over the edge. Starlight is forced to make an impossible choice. Stormfront reveals her true character.

episodes.title: Nothing Like It in the World
episodes.description: Milk, Hughie, and Annie go on a road trip to find Liberty. Frenchie has relationship problems, and Homelander continues to unravel.

episodes.title: We Gotta Go Now
episodes.description: Butcher has no more intentions to fight with Supes but Black Noir traced his location and found him: what will he do now? Supes are shooting a film named - #Dawn Of The Seven. Homelander is doing what Stormfront told him to do.

episodes.title: The Bloody Doors Off
episodes.description: When The Boys and Starlight follow a lead to Vought's mysterious Sage Grove Center, they find one of Vought's darkest secrets - and someone even darker from their past. Meanwhile Homelander and Stormfront's relationship deepens.

episodes.title: Butcher, Baker, Candlestick Maker
episodes.description: To help Victoria Neuman make a case against Vought, Mallory and The Boys look to an unlikely source for answers. Hughie gets terrifying news about Starlight. Meanwhile, Homelander and Stormfront further their master plan for Compound V.

episodes.title: What I Know
episodes.description: Becca shows up on Butcher's doorstep and begs for his help. The Boys agree to back Butcher, and together with Starlight, they finally face off against Homelander and Stormfront. But things go very bad, very fast.

episodes.title: Payback
episodes.description: One year following Stormfront's public controversy, Butcher and the Boys now work as contractors for Neuman's Bureau of Superhero Affairs in order to apprehend problematic Supes, with Hughie acting as their liaison.

episodes.title: The Only Man in the Sky
episodes.description: Homelander, America's greatest Supe. Defending our shores from sea to shining sea. Today, America honors him on his birthday. Vought Shopping Network is celebrating by offering an exclusive Homelander Limited Birthday Edition Gold Coin.

episodes.title: Barbary Coast
episodes.description: Tonight at 9/8C on Vought Plus, it's the season finale of #AmericanHero. Three contestants remain, but only TWO will join #TheSeven. Will Starlight choose her old flame Supersonic? Or will someone else be moving into the Seven Tower?

episodes.title: Glorious Five Year Plan
episodes.description: The Boys search for a mysterious weapon in Russia while things are brewing behind the scenes at Vought. Plenty of trouble, gore and twists to foresee.

episodes.title: The Last Time to Look on This World of Lies
episodes.description: The Boys run into a major obstacle in their mission to stop the Seven and turn their attention to Soldier Boy. Homelander continues to make changes that fit his agenda at Vought International.

episodes.title: Herogasm
episodes.description: Youre invited to the 70th Annual Herogasm! You must present this invitation in order to be admitted! Same rules as always: no cameras, no non-Supe guests unless they sign an NDA and theyre DTF, and no telling any news media! Its BYOD, but food, alcohol and lube will be provided! And please remember to RSVP so we can get an accurate headcount for the caterer!

episodes.title: Here Comes a Candle to Light You to Bed
episodes.description: Everything's changing as never expected for the Homelander. Soldier Boy is searching for the other old payback members to slay. Black Noir recollects what has really got him to the current situation.

episodes.title: The Instant White-Hot Wild
episodes.description: Calling all patriots! Let's show Homelander we've got his back and we're not going to let Starlight and her House of Horrors get away with trafficking children and drinking their adrenaline! It's time for real Americans to fight back! Join the Hometeamers and Stormchasers tomorrow at Vought Square! Stand back and stand by!

episodes.title: Department of Dirty Tricks
episodes.description: After Butcher misses his opportunity to kill Homelander by Soldier Boy, he attempts to get Ryan back on his side and correct his mistakes. Meanwhile, Homelander seeks out a new ally as he struggles to come to terms with his mortality.

episodes.title: Life Among the Septics
episodes.description: Did you know that globalists put chemicals in our food that make us gay, Dakota Bob is a demon from hell, and the Moon isn't real? Find out what they want to keep from us #TruthCon.

episodes.title: We'll Keep the Red Flag Flying Here
episodes.description: The problems have started between Homelander and Starlight supporters. Hughie tries to figure out what's going on between Homelander and Victoria Neuman.

episodes.title: Wisdom of the Ages
episodes.description: Vought News Network is proud to announce its new series #Truthbomb! Join host Firecracker and her celebrity guests for the live 6-hour premiere as they expose Starlight's Adrenochrome Parties!

episodes.title: Beware the Jabberwock, My Son
episodes.description: While caring for his dying father, Hughie faces intrigue at Vought. Homelander bonds with Ryan, and the Boys break Stan out to obtain the Anti-Supe virus, battling killer sheep along the way.

episodes.title: Dirty Business
episodes.description: Vernon Correctional Services provides compassionate rehabilitation to those in our care to prepare them for successful community reentry. At Vernon, it's not about custody. It's about family.

episodes.title: The Insider
episodes.description: Hey kids. Did you know your neighbor, uncle, or even Mom and Dad might be trying to destroy America? Find out how to stop them on the Avenue V Christmas Special!. If you see something, say something!.

episodes.title: Season Four Finale
episodes.description: Calling all patriots! We will not allow this stolen election to be certified tomorrow! We must stop Bob Singer's woke anti-Supe agenda! PREPARE FOR WAR! #WhereWeGoOneWeGoVought

series.title: Dragon Raja -The Blazing Dawn-
series.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Coming-of-Age, Documentary, Drama, Fantasy, Supernatural Fantasy, Urban Adventure, Mandarin
series.description: An ordinary high school student, Lu Mingfei, one day received an admission letter from Cassel College, a foreign private university. After hesitating and hesitating, Lu Mingfei decided to find out.

episodes.title: Travels
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei takes a special train to the mysterious Cassel College, and discovers the school's true purpose.

episodes.title: Day of Freedom
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei arrives at Cassel on the Day of Freedom, a day when anything is allowed. Within his first few minutes of arriving, he finds himself in the middle of a gunfight.

episodes.title: Two Dragon Emperors
episodes.description: When Lu Mingfei fails to react at all to the 3E test, the professors suspect that he is heir to a powerful legacy.

episodes.title: Dragon Palace
episodes.description: Two students of Cassel College become trapped in a mysterious dragon palace at the bottom of a dam site lake.

episodes.title: Spoils of Victory
episodes.description: Aki and Ye Sheng fight to escape from the underwater palace before their air runs out, but something terrible waits for them down below.

episodes.title: Intruders
episodes.description: As Lu Mingfei is invited to a fancy party, a group of intruders assaults the campus.

episodes.title: Unleashing Yanling
episodes.description: With the Night Watchman's protective Yanling disabled, the students are free to unleash their full powers.

episodes.title: The Dragon Emperor of Bronze and Flames
episodes.description: As Lu Mingfei speaks with Nono atop a mountain, the battle for the urn comes to a conclusion.

episodes.title: Vow to Reunite
episodes.description: A powerful dragon stalks the campus as Lu Mingfei reunites with an old friend.

episodes.title: Brotherly Memories
episodes.description: Lao Tang regains his memories as the principal's plans for the dragons are revealed.

episodes.title: Dangerous Mission
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei is selected to go on a deadly underwater mission beneath a dam.

episodes.title: Dragon's Lair
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei infiltrates the heart of the Dragon Emperor's lair and is shocked by what he sees.

episodes.title: Escape from the Labyrinth
episodes.description: Nono and Lu Mingfei try to escape from the Dragon Emperor's palace after planting a devastating bomb, but the dragons won't let them escape easily.

episodes.title: Our Full Strength
episodes.description: Cassel College's top leaders, Chu Zihang and Caesar, bring their full power to bear against Norton.

episodes.title: Deal With the Devil
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei makes a deal with potentially devastating consequences to get the power he needs to save Nono.

episodes.title: The End of Battle
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei's duel against Norton comes to an end, but at what cost?

episodes.title: Subject Zero
episodes.description: Subject Zero transforms into its dragon form, destroyed the warplanes and fled Black Swan Port with Renata. They were chased by various forces. As Subject Zero's body slowly deteriorated, it chose to make a deal with Angers.

episodes.title: The Dark Storm of Torrential Rain
episodes.description: On a stormy night years ago, Typhoon lands. Chu Tianjiao and his son, Chu Zihang, enter Nibelungen and face Odin's pursuit. Chu Tianjiao protects the mysterious black box, battling Odin and Deadpool, while Chu Zihang awakens his bloodline.

episodes.title: Birthday Cake is the Tombstone of Youth
episodes.description: On Lu Mingfei's birthday, Chu Zihang claims to be his junior and attends a class reunion to support him. He even uses a promise to mobilize the entire Kassel Academy, securing Lu Mingfei a chance for a date.

episodes.title: The King's Chosen Servant
episodes.description: Chu Zihang and Lu Mingfei identified the south station culprit with Nuonuos help and profiling ability.

episodes.title: The Dance of the Flaming Demon Sword
episodes.description: Chu Zihang's mission is getting more complicated and he has less and less time to complete it.

episodes.title: The Nibelungen Plan
episodes.description: At the meeting of the School Board, Anjou initiated the Nibelungen Plan, which Caesar attended as a candidate.

episodes.title: Dandelion
episodes.description: Lu Mingze wishes Lu Mingfei a happy birthday, tempting him with power in exchange for his life.

episodes.title: Beware of Fire, Theft, and Brothers
episodes.description: Xia Mi is invited to stay at a hotel with Chu Zihang and Lu Mingfei. Xia Mi and Chu Zihang share similar interests, while Lu Mingfei becomes the third wheel. Early next morning, Lu Mingfei receives a message from Lu Mingze, informing him of an important event.

episodes.title: A Feast for Dragons
episodes.description: Anjou rushes to the auction with Lu Mingfei, and defeats some assassins along the way. Upon arriving at the venue, Lu Mingfei, dressed in the attire of a nouveau riche, joins this feast of hybrids, waiting for an "unexpected encounter."

episodes.title: Show Me The Money
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei and the mysterious Muslim girl bid against each other for the Seven Deadly Sins, forcing him to use a temporary Yanling. He remains unaware that this entire scheme is orchestrated by the boss behind Sakatoku Mai. After the auction, the mysterious girl draws suspicion and encirclement from various factions, including the Thirteen Nobles.

episodes.title: Fall in the Atrium
episodes.description: Anjou and the Thirteen Nobles part ways due to ideological differences. He takes Lu Mingfei to the theme park to meet up with Chu Zihang and Xia Mi, but encounters a roller coaster accident. Lu Mingze once again tempts Lu Mingfei to trade his life to resolve the crisis.

episodes.title: Dragon Emperor of Earth and Mountain
episodes.description: Under the influence of Zero Time, Chu Zihang resolves the crisis by unleashing his Blood Rage, but is severely injured. Fortunately, he is saved by Xia Mi. Following this incident, the School Board believes that the Dragon Emperor of Earth and Mountain has awakened, and begins to suspect Chu Zihang's bloodline.

episodes.title: The Dragon Bone Cross
episodes.description: After the theme park incident, Chu Zihang and Xia Mi grow closer. Anjou's conflict with the Board intensifies.

episodes.title: Battle of the Mad Dragons
episodes.description: The intruders engage in a fierce battle, and Lu Mingfei seizes the opportunity to reinforce the barrier around the dragon bones with the Seven Deadly Sins. As the battle intensifies, the mysterious figure and Sakatoku Mai fight in their dragon forms. The earth shakes, and the raging flames destroy Cassell's underground complex, and erupt through the surface.

episodes.title: The Bloodline Covenant
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei delivers a righteous rebuttal against the School Board's allegations at the hearing against Chu Zihang, but is ultimately overshadowed by Caesar. Although Chu Zihang's bloodline is found to be innocent, he is still rejected by the Seven Deadly Sins

episodes.title: The Dragon Emperor's Trail
episodes.description: Chu Zihang learns the secrets of the Nibelungen Plan and must slay the Dragon Emperor to survive.

episodes.title: The Person Behind the Scenes
episodes.description: Chu Zihang detects irregularities in the subway. Lu Mingfei uses a Yanling and teaches some thugs a lesson.

episodes.title: The Labyrinth
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei is attacked by the Wind Devil Queen and encounters the missing Execution Bureau specialists.

episodes.title: Your Real Name
episodes.description: With Lu Mingze's help, Lu Mingfei wins the card game and finds the Dragon Emperor Fenrir.

episodes.title: An Invitation From a Foreign Land
episodes.description: Lu Mingfei is a high school student who receives an invitation from a mysterious university in a foreign land. He has a crush on a girl at his school, though, and is forced to choose between his love and future.

series.title: Tsukimichi: Moonlit Fantasy
series.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Anime, Comedy, Fantasy, Japanese, Sword & Sorcery, Teen Fantasy, Isekai
series.description: Makoto Misumi, an ordinary teenager, is summoned to a fantasy world to be its hero. However, the goddess judges him unattractive and dismisses him from his duties.

episodes.title: Failed... Hero
episodes.description: Misumi Makoto is taken to another world as a hero. But he is immediately rejected and thrown into a wasteland because the goddess found him to be too ugly.

episodes.title: Black Spider of Disaster
episodes.description: With the help of Tomoe, Misumi Makoto decides to build a town. Highlander Orcs are invited in the town but a huge black spider attacks the town.

episodes.title: Human Shock
episodes.description: Misumi Makoto desires to meet human in this new world and after a lot of efforts he finally finds a city of human. When he tries to go near the human city they attack him fearing that he is a monster.

episodes.title: Too Late
episodes.description: A girl (Rinon) approaches Misumi Makoto's group. They learn that the Rinon's older sister is held captive by a group of bandit. Makoto decides to help.

episodes.title: The Greedy Wagon's Journey
episodes.description: Makoto journeys with a group of survivors from the bandit camp. On the road, they accidentally run into rare mobs.

episodes.title: The Melancholy of Handsome Middle-Aged Men
episodes.description: To bring prosperity to his people, Makoto attempts to register as a merchant.

episodes.title: Wondrous Medicine Production
episodes.description: Makoto meets a man whose family is plagued by a curse.

episodes.title: Demiplane Ranking
episodes.description: Tomoe mentors a young group of adventures attempting to make a name for themselves.

episodes.title: Eat or Be Eaten
episodes.description: The residents of Mist Town celebrate Makoto. A female human peaks his interest in town

episodes.title: The Demon's Hidden Village
episodes.description: Makoto visits a hidden village in hopes of forging a trade deal. He meets two disciples and their master.

episodes.title: Goodbye
episodes.description: Makoto investigates an attack in Mist Town.

episodes.title: Guided by the Moon...
episodes.description: Makoto wages war against the demon army.

episodes.title: What? Moon over the Ruined Castle?
episodes.description: Mikoto and Shiki are making their way to Rotsgard Academy in hopes of opening a new store. Meanwhile, back in the demiplane, everyone is helping Mio practice her cooking skills by taste testing her dishes.

episodes.title: The Heroes Are a Couple of Beauties
episodes.description: We meet one of Misumi Makoto's classmates back on earth, who also has a curious encounter with a certain goddess who presides over a certain isekai. She and one other are sent there as heroes to help the hyumans defeat the demons.

episodes.title: Stellar Wars
episodes.description: Hibiki and Tomoki's parties prepare for the attack on Fort Stella (the one Makoto ended up being somewhat involved in against his will). The two human heroes couldn't be more different, posing challenges beyond the simple difficulty of facing the demons.

episodes.title: Why Am I a Teacher?!
episodes.description: Makoto finally arrives in Rotsgard, but is shocked to find that he's somehow ended up registered to take a teacher's exam instead of one for students. On the way there, he crosses paths with some haughty students of the school...

episodes.title: The Lesson Will Now Begin
episodes.description: Makoto starts planning his curriculum and class size now that he's employed at Rotsgard Academy. He wants to teach students to expand their use of elemental magic, but his first class seems to think that's simply impossible.

episodes.title: Becoming a Three-Star Chef
episodes.description: Makoto is finally able to open his new shop in Rotsgard, but convincing staff to work there rather than Tsige is a bit of a challenge. He later has a talk with Eva about this world's view of marriage, which doesn't sit well with him.

episodes.title: New Member Audition
episodes.description: Makoto returns to the demiplane to check out his new house, which has finally completed construction. He arrives to find that the weather is unseasonably hot, and the source of the problem might be his fault.

episodes.title: The Notorious Beautiful Sisters
episodes.description: Makoto had a busy but fun time in the demiplane. After finishing his business, he returns to Rotsgard with Shiki. Meanwhile, at Rotsgard Academy, Shifu and Yuno Rembrandt have returned to school and will attend a lecture with transfer student Karen Force.

episodes.title: The Perverted Dragon
episodes.description: Lime sets out to investigate hyuman experiments that are secretly being carried out in Rotsgard. He ends up being captured by an underground organization along with Eva. After that, the two manage to escape and meet up with Shin and the others.

episodes.title: Watch As I Improve the World
episodes.description: Shin and company begin full-scale action to destroy the underground organization with demon general Rona's help. The group discovers that the mastermind is Bright, an instructor at Rotsgard Academy. Bright's willingness to make sacrifices angers Makoto.

episodes.title: Summer of Growth and New Skills
episodes.description: Finally get to meet the heroes and see just how strong they are - while realizing that they're people he knows from his previous world

episodes.title: Attack of the Giant Monsters
episodes.description: Near summer's end, highland orcs exploring the forest face attacks from wolves and bears. Makoto ventures into the woods, hoping for peace but encounters a hostile bear.

episodes.title: The Very Busy Academy Festival
episodes.description: As the academy festival nears, priest Shinai urgently meets Makoto to discuss concerning rumors about the shop's medicine. He presents a plan to help clear the shop's reputation.

episodes.title: I'm Not a Fan of High Society
episodes.description: Makoto, a trader, attends a festival luncheon where Sairitsu, a Commonwealth official, approaches him due to the foreign lettering on his company's sign, hinting at his otherworldly origins.

episodes.title: A Fierce Tournament
episodes.description: Students take on the individual competition in the school festival's highlight event, the combat tournament. Due to a nobleman plot, they are forced to face off against their peers. Jin advances to the finals and faces off against Ilumgand Hopleys.

episodes.title: A Certain Student's Secret
episodes.description: Due to the incident with Zara, Makoto decides to join the demons, and after witnessing the fighting tournament, he decides to leave Rotsgard. The next day, Jin and his friends advance to the finals of the team competition and face a team led by Ilumgand.

episodes.title: Mutation Hazard
episodes.description: Ilumgand was transformed into a monster. Jin and Abelia launch an attack to stop him. However, their attacks have no effect, and they lose their fighting spirit and energy in the face of an enemy stronger than ever.

episodes.title: Fall of the Academy City
episodes.description: Rotsgard's turmoil continues. Numerous mutants have appeared in the city and Jin and his friends attempt to subjugate them. Meanwhile, Mio, who has been ordered by Makoto to protect the shelter, detects a strange smell from Makoto during her mission.

episodes.title: The Unruly Merchant
episodes.description: Mutant turmoil rages on as transformed individuals emerge at an evacuation center, causing anxiety and exhaustion. Misumi's group joins forces tasked with subduing mutants, aiming to change the dire situation.

episodes.title: The Utterly Hateable Good-for-Nothing
episodes.description: While armies battle mutant hordes, demon forces launch a surprise attack on two kingdoms. The human defenders are overwhelmed, leaving both realms facing imminent defeat.

episodes.title: The Heroes Fight Bravely
episodes.description: Tomoe, Mio, and the residents of the demiplane are ordered by Makoto to take back Kaleneon, and enter enemy territory. Meanwhile, in the Gritonia Empire, Tomoki and his friends head to the battlefield, where they encounter Sofia standing in their way.

episodes.title: Fight On, Hero!
episodes.description: Makoto is shaken by the revelation that the hero he meets on the battlefield is his high school senior, Hibiki Otonashi. Unable to dwell on it, Makoto enters a battle with Io to whom he suggests the demons retreat, in order to avoid a pointless battle.

episodes.title: Rival Revenge Match
episodes.description: Two fighters face off until Sofia storms in, determined to defeat her nemesis Makoto in an explosive confrontation.

episodes.title: Sorcerer vs Draconid
episodes.description: Outside Limia's royal castle, a fierce battle between Shiki and Mitsurugi unfolds. Meanwhile, inside the castle, the battle between Makoto and Sofia continues. Sofia, at a loss, unleashes her secret weapon.

episodes.title: Party Beneath the Moonlight
episodes.description: After the Limia battle, Makoto returns to the demiplane, welcomed by Tomoe, Mio, and residents. A celebration follows before he departs for Rotsgard to eliminate the remaining mutants, ending the turmoil.

series.title: IT: Welcome to Derry
series.genre: Dark Fantasy, Fantasy, Monster Horror, Period Drama, Psychological Horror, Supernatural Fantasy, Supernatural Horror, Teen Horror, Body Horror, Slasher Horror
series.description: In 1962, a couple with their son move to Derry, Maine just as a young boy disappears. With their arrival, very bad things begin to happen in the town.

episodes.title: The Pilot
episodes.description: Four months after a classmate vanishes, Teddy, Phil, Lilly and Ronnie investigate missing children and strange events in Derry. Major Leroy Hanlon faces a cold welcome at Derry Air Force Base.

episodes.title: The Thing in the Dark
episodes.description: Charlotte and Will navigate their new life in Derry. Ronnie worries about her father's fate.

episodes.title: Now You See It
episodes.description: Shaw orders Hallorann's aerial search with Leroy and Pauly after a disappointing find. Rose joins a tribal meeting about military in Derry, while Ronnie's group tries to photograph an Orix.

episodes.title: The Great Swirling Apparatus of Our Planet's Function
episodes.description: As the kids face increasingly terrifying experiences, Charlotte attempts to advocate for Hank, and General Shaw escalates his efforts.

series.title: Fire Force
series.genre: Action, Adult Animation, Animation, Anime, Dark Fantasy, Drama, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Japanese, Shonen, Supernatural Fantasy
series.description: A superhuman firefighter force is formed to deal with supernatural fire incidents.

episodes.title: Shinra Kusakabe Enlists
episodes.description: On his first day with Special Fire Force Company 8, Shinra Kusakabe, a third-generation pyrokinetic who is able to produces flames from his feet, meets his fellow company members and begins to fulfil his wish of becoming a hero.

episodes.title: The Heart of a Fire Soldier
episodes.description: A new fire force recruit joins Station 8. This new recruit is Arthur Boyle and claims to be the Knight King. The relationship between Shinra and Arthur may cause some problems within Station 8.

episodes.title: The Rookie Fire Soldier Games
episodes.description: Shinra and Arthur compete in the Rookie Fire Soldier Games, a contest to test the abilities of each year's newest recruits. However, they are interrupted at the goal by the mysterious man who created explosions at their last fire scene.

episodes.title: The Hero and the Princess
episodes.description: A call mistakenly comes in to Company 8 to rescue a dog out of a tree, to which Shinra and Arthur respond. However, when an Infernal suddenly appears at the district courthouse, the two must play catch-up to join the rest of the company.

episodes.title: The Battle Begins
episodes.description: While jogging, Shinra inadvertently disturbs Iris's purification rite, and sees that she is troubled. When Iris later turns up missing, the other members of Company 8 rally to Company 5's compound, to which Iris had secretly slipped away.

episodes.title: The Spark of Promise
episodes.description: Shinra confronts Hibana in an attempt to rescue Iris, and must once again deal with her ability to make his body shut down. The story of Hibana and Iris's youth as orphans, as well as Hibana's rise to prominence, is revealed.

episodes.title: The Investigation of the 1st Commences
episodes.description: The members of Company 5 and 8 get together for a cookout, ostensibly to celebrate a successful nighttime training exercise. Using the bylaws of the Special Fire Force, Obi gets Shinra and Arthur temporarily assigned to the 1st to investigate it.

episodes.title: Infernal Insects
episodes.description: Obi goes over Hibana's research, and learns that the artificially-created Infernals she dissected all had traces of insect DNA in them. Shinra and Arthur's investigation at the 1st continues, and they finally get their first lead on a culprit.

episodes.title: The Spreading Malice
episodes.description: Tamaki watches on as Shinra confronts Rekka over his actions, and reminisces about how she once looked up to the lieutenant. Rekka reveals his objective in seeking out compatible children, one which could spell disaster for the entire world.

episodes.title: The Promise
episodes.description: A captains' conference is convened to allow the Special Fire Force to discuss the situation with the Evangelist and the White-Clad.

episodes.title: Formation of Special Fire Force Company 8/The Mightiest Hikeshi
episodes.description: While Company 8 searches for clues about the Evangelist, Hinawa recounts the tale of how the company originally came into existence. A lead prompts the crew to pay a visit to Company 7's jurisdiction in Asakusa, and its captain, Benimaru.

episodes.title: Eve of Hostilities in Asakusa
episodes.description: Company 8 pitches in to help rebuild Asakusa after the latest Infernal incident, helping to gain the trust of its people. However, a White-Clad plot threatens to undo all of their goodwill, prompting Obi to take matters into his own hands.

episodes.title: The Trap is Set
episodes.description: With Konro's help, the members of the 8th begin investigating events in the 7th's jurisdiction. Chaos breaks out one dozens of cases of mistaken identity crop up, and the town's people turn on each other. The 8th comes under White-Clad attack.

episodes.title: For Whom the Flames Burn
episodes.description: As Asakusa burns around them, Konro encourages Benimaru to step into his role as a community leader. Benimaru devises a way for the townspeople to foil the designs of the impostors among the crowd. Konro reaches out to Shinra for help.

episodes.title: The Blacksmith's Dream
episodes.description: Viktor Licht is assigned to Company 8 as its forensic scientist, but he is viewed with suspicion, since the assignment came from Haijima. Obi sends Shinra, Arthur and Iris to speak to a man named Vulcan about joining the 8th as its engineer.

episodes.title: We Are Family
episodes.description: Vulcan teaches Yu a lesson in the importance of forging things that cannot be broken, and his hope to create similarly unbreakable family ties. Sensing a threat to Vulcan, the members of Company 8 take up positions to keep him safe.

episodes.title: Black and White and Gray
episodes.description: While Dr. Giovanni continues to search Vulcan's workshop, Hibana comes to Shinra's aid, allowing him to rush back to help Vulcan. Meanwhile, Arthur has his hands full trying to deal with Mirage's illusions, and Iris resists in her own way.

episodes.title: The Secrets of Pyrokinesis
episodes.description: Vulcan gets settled in at the 8th, while Captain Obi meets with Hibana, Konro, and Karim to exchange data on the White-Clad matter. Konro proposes that Shinra and Arthur be given combat training in Asakusa to improve their fighting skills.

episodes.title: Into the Nether
episodes.description: Licht's analysis of the attack on Vulcan's workshop reveals that the Evangelist's men have been in the "Nether," the area beneath Tokyo. Company 8 proceeds underground in search of the White-Clad and the secrets behind human combustion.

episodes.title: Wearing His Pride
episodes.description: Hinawa comes upon an abandoned subway station, where he gets into a shootout with Arrow. Arthur and Mirage find themselves in a rematch, as Arthur gets the chance to put the training he received from Benimaru and Konro to the test.

episodes.title: Those Connected
episodes.description: Obi and Vulcan face off against Dr. Giovanni and Lisa, during which Giovanni tells Obi more about the nature of Adolla Bursts. Shinra has an unusual experience that leads him to find Sho, but.,.,

episodes.title: A Brother's Determination
episodes.description: As Shinra and Sho continue to share their Adolla Link, Shinra learns a startling truth about the origin of his Adolla Burst flame.

episodes.title: Smile
episodes.description: Shinra shares his past with Sho as their bond deepens; the 8th seeks Capt. Huang's help when one of their members is injured.

episodes.title: The Burning Past
episodes.description: Before being discharged from the hospital, Shinra is visited by Captain Burns, who offers to tell him all about the fire that happened 12 years ago, but only if Shinra can demonstrate that he is strong enough to hear the whole truth.

episodes.title: A Fire Soldier's Fight
episodes.description: Company 8's junior crewman shop for some new clothes for Lieutenant Hinawa, but their excursion is interrupted; the 8th prepares for the annual Special Fire Force Beefcake Calendar shoot.

episodes.title: Flames of Madness
episodes.description: Shinra is approved to have a meeting with Company 4 Captain Hague, who may be able to provide information on the Evangelist and Adolla Bursts. However, once the meeting starts, nearly everyone involved begins behaving erratically.

episodes.title: A New Flashpoint
episodes.description: Obi goes to see the chief with news of a fifth Adolla-Burst bearer. Schoolgirl Inca, who has the ability to sniff out fires before they start, becomes notorious as the Fireground Thief.

episodes.title: Groping Through the Fire
episodes.description: A widespread outbreak of fires stretches the members of Company 8 thin. Shinra tries to keep Charon and his men from taking Inca. With a shortage of ecclesiastical assistance, the crew members cannot put the Infernals to rest fast enough.

episodes.title: Corna (Sign of the Devil) / A Secret Plan
episodes.description: Shinra makes an important discovery about how to fight Charon, but incorporating a new hand form into his fighting style proves difficult. The other Fire Soldiers put into action a novel approach toward putting to rest a demon Infernal.

episodes.title: The Time to Choose
episodes.description: Inca is faced with the decision of whether to go with Shinra and the Fire Force, or to go with Charon and side with the Evangelist.

episodes.title: Road to the Oasis
episodes.description: The task force arrives on the Chinese Peninsula and sets off through inhospitable territory toward a spatial rift that they hope will provide the answers they seek. They also pick up an unexpected companion along the way.

episodes.title: Smoldering Malevolence
episodes.description: Scop tells the team about a mysterious woman in black robes that taught him how to speak, and who repaired the Tabernacle. The team's mission takes a turn when intelligent Infernals show up at the Oasis.

episodes.title: The Core
episodes.description: Pan, Arthur and Licht continue to investigate the inside of the Tabernacle, while outside, the rest of the team have their hands full fighting off an Infernal attack.

episodes.title: The Woman in Black
episodes.description: Through Adolla Links and the assistance of Grace, Shinra learns more about the Evangelist and views Tempe's memories. The team completes their investigation into the Tabernacle, but draw some unsettling conclusions from what they learn.

episodes.title: Dark Hero
episodes.description: After reporting their findings to Obi, the team is dismayed to hear that their discoveries are being quashed by the church. Joker approaches Benimaru with a proposition concerning the Holy Sol Temple.

episodes.title: Shadows Cast by Divine Light
episodes.description: Joker and Benimaru break their way into the church for the hidden scriptures. When Benimaru presses Joker for answers as to how he knows so much, Joker tells him about his past, revealing some dark secrets about the Holy Sol Temple.

episodes.title: A Pair of One-Eyes
episodes.description: Burns confronts Joker and Benimaru, then offers them the scant leads he has uncovered during his own personal probe of the Holy Sol Temple. Konro reports Benimaru's findings to the 8th.

episodes.title: The Ashen Reaper
episodes.description: Licht reveals that he has been spying on them for Haijima. Licht and Shinra come up with a plan to get inside the child pyrokinesis lab where Shinra was institutionalized as a child to uncover some dirt on Haijima.

episodes.title: A Three-Way Melee
episodes.description: At Licht's signal, the rest of the 8th breaks into the Haijima compound, where Vulcan and Maki confront an overpowered puppeteer. The rest of the company meets up with Shinra and Licht, who are facing Kurono, when a third party shows up.

episodes.title: Mind Blown
episodes.description: The three-way battle between Haijima, the White-Clad, and the 8th continues, but when Ritsu and Haumea both use their unique abilities, everyone involved is placed in imminent danger. It's up to Vulcan and Arthur to turn things around.

episodes.title: Boys, Be Weak
episodes.description: As Nataku continues to rampage, Shinra Adolla Links with him, revealing the pressure his parents placed on him to succeed. When the threat Nataku poses comes to a head, his protection as one of the Pillars comes from an unlikely source.

episodes.title: The Holy Woman's Anguish / The Man, Assault
episodes.description: A routine trip to the Baptism Church to bless the 8th's equipment reveals the crisis of faith that Iris and other Holy Sol Temple clergy are facing. Assault is back and ready to take on Tamaki.

episodes.title: The Oze Family
episodes.description: Maki returns home for a family dinner, where her brother Takigi asks her about her time in the Nether. When Takigi is injured in a White-Clad attack, Maki's father recalls her to the military.

episodes.title: Weapon of Destruction
episodes.description: Company 2 and Company 8 launch a joint, multi-pronged investigation into the Nether, and are met with resistance by the White-Clad. The squad containing Tamaki and Juggernaut faces a particularly deadly new foe named Orochi.

episodes.title: Enemy Contact
episodes.description: Tamaki struggles to get Juggernaut back to the surface. Takigi and Hinawa find themselves at odds with each other, as well as with a new threat from the White-Clad. Shinra suddenly comes face to face against an old adversary.

episodes.title: Plot for Extinction
episodes.description: Shinra and Arthur continue their battle against Dr. Giovanni, who reveals some new information about Adolla Links. Licht discovers an imminent crisis threatening the Fire Soldiers in the Nether, as well as the Tokyo Empire at large.

episodes.title: Firecat
episodes.description: Shinra wants to know why he was able to Link with Konro, while Hibana remains suspicious of him. Benimaru invites Shinra and Arthur back to the 7th for more training, and Tamaki, tired of being a burden to others, comes along as well.

episodes.title: Signs of Upheaval
episodes.description: Benimaru continues to push Shinra and Arthur to their limits in order to unlock their Hysterical Strength. Captain Huang examines Konro at Hibana's request, as she tries to uncover the mysteries of those who have been touched by Adolla.

episodes.title: Indomitable Resolve
episodes.description: Captain Obi and the Chief celebrated the 8th astounding achievement in uniting the Fire Force and unraveling great mysteries, but that celebration is immediately cut short. The Tokyo Empire army bursts in and arrests Captain Obi.

episodes.title: Prisoner
episodes.description: The 8th takes action to rescue Obi. Labeled as traitors, they go on the run, then Joker appears before them.

episodes.title: Incarnation of Flame
episodes.description: Obi is imprisoned in Fuchu Penitentiary. Shinra and Joker arrive before Hinawa and the encounter begins.

episodes.title: Golden Secret
episodes.description: The 8th faces difficulty opposing Gold's abilities until an unforeseen ally joins the battle.

episodes.title: Chance Meeting with an Arch-Enemy
episodes.description: Obi writhes in pain. Burns attacks Shinra relentlessly. A Destroyer called Dragon blocks the 8th's path.

episodes.title: Beyond Prayer's End
episodes.description: Shinra and Burns continue their fierce fight. A hero's emotions battle against a Sol servant's determination. The outcome remains uncertain.

episodes.title: Sleeping Truth
episodes.description: Benimaru stands untouched before the White-Clad as they attempt a takedown. While Hibana and Karim go back to the roots to uncover the mystery of doppelgangers.

episodes.title: Holy Mother of Darkness / The Knight King's Great Adventure
episodes.description: Sister Sumire reveals hell before Hibana, Karim and also Yan Li as they plan to stop this force of evil. Meanwhile, Arthur reaches out for hope and sets out on an adventure with Vulcan.

episodes.title: Holy Sword, Resurrected
episodes.description: Arthur's journey leads to the appearance of his parents as they act oblivious while sharing knowledge about the world. The Holy Sword Excalibur is finalized as Shinra tries to reconnect with Sho.

episodes.title: Advent
episodes.description: Through an Adolla Link vision, Sho chooses to visit his brother one final time before the Great Cataclysm occurs.

episodes.title: The Great Kaiju Battlefront
episodes.description: The Great Cataclysm is set in motion. A giant pillar appears in the Pacific. Shinra asks to be sent in, while Company 2 engages in an attack on a titanic Infernal.

episodes.title: The Madness of the Distant Past
episodes.description: Faerie captures an unconscious Shinra. Sho appears and attacks. Shinra receives advice from a surprising source.

series.title: Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku
series.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Anime, Dark Fantasy, Drama, Fantasy, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Japanese, Shonen
series.description: A squad of prisoners and their guards are sent to investigate a mysterious island. They get stranded there and must rely on each other to survive the island's mysterious and monstrous residents.

episodes.title: The Death Row Convict and the Executioner
episodes.description: Gabimaru the Hollow has been sentenced to death. Carrying out that sentence, however, may require the services of an extraordinary professional.

episodes.title: Screening and Choosing
episodes.description: The condemned criminals are gathered on the beach to prepare for the expedition to Shinsenkyo, but first, they must reduce their numbers.

episodes.title: Weakness and Strength
episodes.description: Gabimaru and Sagiri arrive on the island, but immediately get into a fight over what should be the right course of action.

episodes.title: Hell and Paradise
episodes.description: Gabimaru and Sagiri meet the kunoichi Yuzuriha and her executioner Senta, and they decide to team up to make their way through the island.

episodes.title: The Samurai and the Woman
episodes.description: Gabimaru and Sagiri's group cross paths with Yamada Asaemon Genji, who takes a dim view of Sagiri's involvement in the present matter. Meanwhile, Yamada Asaemon Tenza tries to find a way off the island along with his charge, Nurugai.

episodes.title: Heart and Reason
episodes.description: Rokurota, the Giant of Bizen, attacks Gabimaru and Sagiri's party. Meanwhile, Chobe and Toma's paths cross with another party's while they look for sustenance in the mountains.

episodes.title: Flowers and Offerings
episodes.description: Chobe and Toma encounter people unlike any they've ever encountered before. Gabimaru and Sagiri's party finally meet people who live on the island.

episodes.title: Student and Master
episodes.description: Tenza and Nurugai are assaulted by an island resident. Even when Tenza's teacher Shion rescues them, it's not enough to save them.

episodes.title: Gods and People
episodes.description: Sagiri's group sets off in search of Horai. Gabimaru goes ahead and encounters the same powerful being that confronted Tenza.

episodes.title: Yin and Yang
episodes.description: Mei attempts to explain something very important to Sagiri party in the forest. Shion tries to explain how he interacts with the world to Nurugai. A mysterious servant of the Tensen tries to explain why Aza Chobe and Toma shouldn't escape.

episodes.title: Weak and Strong
episodes.description: Chobe brings new abilities to bear as he faces the Tensen's servants. A secret of Mei's is revealed to Gabimaru, hardening his resolve to fight and opening him up to a new perception of the world.

episodes.title: Umbrella and Ink
episodes.description: Sagiri and the others set foot in Lord Tensen's territory Horai in their search for Gabimaru. What was waiting for them there is the Tensen Mu Dan.

episodes.title: Dreams and Reality
episodes.description: Sagiri's party faces Mu Dan's seemingly unstoppable true form. Shion does his best to rise to the challenge with his mastery of waves.

series.title: Wind Breaker
series.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Anime, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Martial Arts, Shonen, Teen Adventure, Urban Adventure, Teen Drama
series.description: Haruka Sakura has no interest in weaklings, only the strongest fighters. Starting at Furin High, a school known for student brawlers who protect their town, Haruka seeks to battle his way to the top.

episodes.title: Sakura Arrives at Furin
episodes.description: Haruka Sakura, a delinquent high school loner, admires strength and disregards weakness. Enrolling at the infamous Furin High, he aims to become the top fighter among its delinquents.

episodes.title: The Hero of My Dreams
episodes.description: It is the morning of the school entrance ceremony, and Furin High School has transformed into a group that protects the town now known as the "Chime of the Wind Breaker" - Bofurin.

episodes.title: The Man Who Stands at the Top
episodes.description: Furin High School's first-year Class 1 gains notoriety for its fierce fighters. Angered by Sakura's words, Kyotaro Sugishita lashes out, sparking an intense brawl between them as Hayato Suo observes coolly, and Nirei panics.

episodes.title: Collision
episodes.description: Rival factions Bofurin and Shishitoren clash, with Bofurin protecting middle schoolers. Sakura gets a war declaration from Jo Togame, Shishitoren's second-in-command. She informs Umemiya, along with Toma Hiragi, a Bofurin Four King.

episodes.title: A Gentleman
episodes.description: "That's why I'm going to take all of Furin...and you for myself!" declares Shishitoren's leader, Choji Tomiyama, as he makes his way onto Furin High School grounds. Finally, it's a one-on-one showdown between Bofurin and Shishitoren.

episodes.title: Vow to Follow
episodes.description: Tomiyama and Togame expel their defeated teammate. Sakura is shaken by this, but Suo gets emotional and defeats Minoru Kanuma, securing another win for Bofurin.

episodes.title: Fight to Win
episodes.description: Two highly skilled second-in-command warriors, Sakura and Togame, engage in an intense battle that escalates tensions and ignites a fiery conflict.

episodes.title: Succeeding the Past
episodes.description: Resumed the showdown between Sakura and Togame. As the former confronted the latter about losing his fire midway, Togame dove back into his memories of the past.

episodes.title: Umemiya's Style
